key_points: After the death of his son and the Capitol riot, Rep. Jamie Raskin is focusing on addressing the threat posed by Donald Trump.
Democrats are considering both impeachment and invoking the 25th Amendment as means to remove Trump from office.
Raskin, having recently buried his son, faced the Capitol insurrection with his daughter and son-in-law present.
Named the House's lead manager for Trump's impeachment trial, Raskin emphasizes the urgency in removing Trump from office.
Raskin supports the 25th Amendment as a potential bipartisan solution but is also pushing for impeachment.
He criticizes the Senate's failure to convict Trump during the first impeachment and holds Trump accountable for recent acts.
Raskin reflects on the insurrection at the Capitol, condemning Trump's role and lack of denouncement of the violence.
He raises concerns over Trump possibly pardoning those involved in the Capitol siege.
Raskin recounts the personal impact of the Capitol events on his family, following the recent loss of his son.
The report features in an episode of the 'Start Here' podcast by ABC News, focusing on significant current news.
